data.title: Russian Artist Biography Database: L
data.text:
RUSSIAN ARTISTS

BIOGRAPHY DATABASE

- L-

Larina Valeria Borisovna

(1926 - 2008)

Valeria BorisovnaLarina was born April 10, 1926 in the Leningrad.

In 1953, Valeria Larina graduated from the Repin Institute of Arts in Boris Ioganson workshop.

She studied of Piotr Belousov, Ivan Stepashkin, Alexander Zaytsev.

Since 1953 Valeria Larina has participated in Art Exhibitions.

She painted portraits, genre scenes, landscapes, still-lifes, sketches from the life.

Valeria Larina was a member of the Saint Petersburg Union of Artists since 1954.

Valeria BorisovnaLarina died in Saint Petersburg in 2008.

Paintings by Valeria Larina reside in Art museums and private collections in the Russia, England, Germane, China, Japan, France, and other countries.

Lavrenko Boris Mikhailovich

(1920 - 2000)

Boris Mikhailovich Lavrenko was born May 6, 1920 in the city of Rostov on Don, Soviet Russia.

In 1952 Boris Lavrenko graduated from the Repin Institute of Arts in Rudolf Frentz workshop.

He studied of Mikhail Avilov, Ivan Stepashkin, Piotr Belousov, Boris Ioganson.

Since 1936 Boris Lavrenko has participated in Art Exhibitions.

He painted portraits, genre and historical paintings, landscapes, still-lifes, sketches from the life.

Personal Exhibitions of Boris Lavrenko were in 1972 (Leningrad, Moscow, Rostov on Don), 1986 (Leningrad), and in 1996 (Saint Petersburg).

Boris Lavrenkowas a member of the Saint Petersburg Union of Artists since 1953.

The Honored Artist of the Russian Federation (1976), People`s Artist of the Russian Federation (1994).

Boris Lavrenko was a master of art-criticism (1983), professor of Ilya Repin Institute (1985).

Boris Lavrenko was a Silver medal named by Mitrofan Grekov prize-winner (1980).

Boris Mikhailovich Lavrenko died in Saint Petersburg in 2000.

Paintings by Boris LAVRENKO reside in State Russian Museum, in Art museums and private collections in the Russia, Japan, France, in the U.S., Japan, China, Italy, and throughout the world.

Lavsky Ivan Ivanovich

(1919 - 1977)

Ivan Ivanovich Lavsky was born August 23, 1919 in Dnepropetrovsk, Ukrain.

In 1939 Ivan Lavsky graduated from Dnepropetrovsk Art School in Mikhail Panin workshop.

Since 1947 Ivan Lavsky has participated in Art Exhibitions.

He painted landscapes, genre scenes, cityscapes, sketches from the life.

Ivan Lavsky was a member of the Leningrad Union of Artists since 1956.

Ivan Ivanovich Lavsky died in Leningrad in 1977.

Paintings by Ivan LAVSKY reside in Art museums and private collections in the Russia, Japan, England, and others.

Litvinsky Piotr Petrovich

(1927 - 2009)

Piotr Petrovich Litvinsky was born November 22, 1927 in the Leningrad.

In 1955 Piotr Litvinsky graduated from the Repin Institute of Arts in Rudolf Frentz workshop.

He studied of Piotr Belousov, Ivan Stepashkin, Ivan Sorokin.

Since 1952 Piotr Litvinsky has participated in Art Exhibitions.

He painted portraits, historical and genre pictures, landscapes, still-lifes, cityscapes.

Piotr Litvinskywas a member of the Leningrad Union of Artists since 1955.

Piotr Litvinsky taught at the Vera Mukhina Higher School of Art and Industry (1962-1979), in Alexander Hertzen Pedagogical Institute (1979-1984).

In years 1984-1986, Piotr Litvinsky taught in Vasily Surikov Institute in Moscow, then in Ilya Glazunov Academy of Arts (since 1987) .

The Honored Artist of the Russian Federation (1996).

Piotr Petrovich Litvinsky died in Moscow in 2009.

Paintings by Piotr LITVINSKY reside in Art Museums and private collections in the Russia, Spaine, France, in the U.S., Japan, Italy, and throughout the world.

Lomakin Oleg Leonidovich

(1924 - 2010)

Oleg Leonidovich Lomakin was born August 29, 1924 in the town of Krasny Kholm, Tver Province, USSR.

In 1952 Oleg Lomakin graduated from the Repin Institute of Arts in Boris Ioganson workshop.

He studied of Mikhail Platunov, Leonid Ovsannikov, Alexander Zaytsev.

Since 1952 Oleg Lomakin has participated in Art Exhibitions.

He painted portraits, genre and historical paintings, landscapes.

Oleg Lomakin was a member of the Leningrad Union of Artists since 1952.

A Honored Artist of Russian Federation (1981).

Oleg Leonidovich Lomakin died in Saint Petersburg in 2010.

Paintings by Oleg Lomakin reside in State Russian Museum, in Art museums and private collections in the Russia, France, in the U.S., Japan, and throughout the world.

Lubimov Alexander Mikhailovich

(1879-1955)

Alexander Mikhailovich Lubimov was born February 25, 1879 in the village of Paltsevo, Kursk Province, Russian Empire.

In 1895-1901 Alexander Lubimov studied in Central Technical Drawing School in Saint Petersburg.

In 1909 Alexander Lubimov graduated from Higher Arts School attached to Imperial Academy of Arts in Saint Petersburg.

He studied of Ilya Repin and Piotr Chystiakov.

Since 1900, Alexander Lubimov has participated in Art Exhibitions.

He painted portraits, genre paintings, landscapes, sketches from the life.

Alexander Lubimov worked as painter, graphic artist, illustrator, and satirical black-and-white artist.

His personal exhibitions were in 1949 in Leningrad, and in 1998 in Saint Petersburg.

In years 1912-1919, Alexander Lubimov was a Head of the Secondary Art School in Kharkov, Ukrain.

Alexander Lubimov was a member of the Leningrad Union of Artists since 1932.

In years 1934-1941, Alexander Lubimov taught in the Repin Institute of Arts, professor of painting.

In 1949-1955, Alexander Lubimov taught in the Higher School of Art and Industry named after Vera Mukhina, professor of painting.

His students were well-known Russian painter Alexander Deyneka, Alexander Laktionov, Yuri Neprintsev, Alexander Gritzay, Piotr Belousov, Nikolai Timkov, Mikhail Kozell, Alexey Mozhaev.

Alexander Mikhailovich Lubimov died in Leningrad in 1955.

Paintings by Alexander LUBIMOV reside in State Russian Museum, State Tretyakov Gallery, in Art museums and private collections in the Russia, France, in the U.S., England, and throughout the world.

Lukash Yakov Andreevich

(1909 - 1942)

Yakov Andreevich Lukash was born in 1909 in the village of Novaya Ukrainka, Donetsk Province, Ukrain, Russian Empire.

In 1937-1941, Yakov Lukash studied in Ilya Repin Institute in Viktor Oreshnikov workshop.

He painted portraits, landscapes, genre scenes.

Yakov Lukash has been lost tragically in 1942.

His personal exhibition was in Leningrad in 1965.

Paintings by Yakov LUKASH reside in private collections in the Russia.

BIBLIOGRAPHY

Lyapkalo Viktor Alexandrovich

Viktor AlexandrovichLyapkalo was born September 18, 1956 in Ukhta , Komi Republic, USSR.

In 1987 Viktor Lyapkalo graduated from Ilya Repin Institute in Boris Ugarov workshop.

He studied of Vladimir Gorb, Viktor Reikhet.

Since 1987 Viktor Lyapkalo has participated in Art Exhibitions.

Viktor Lyapkalo paint portraits, naked models, genre scenes, cityscapes.

His personal exhibitions were in Marburg (1992, 1993), Munich (1994), and Saint Petersburg (1996, 1997, 1999, 2002, 2004, 2010).

Viktor Lyapkalo is a member of the Saint Petersburg Union of Artists since 1990.

Paintings by Viktor LYAPKALO reside in a lot of private collections in the Russia, Germane, Holland, France, and throughout the world.

BIBLIOGRAPHY
